intro: Epilobium × tartonnei, commonly known as the common willowherb, is a flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, disturbed soils across temperate regions. The plant features showy pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often reddish and branched. Epilobium × tartonnei is often found in wetlands, riverbanks, and along roadsides, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
